A LITTLE ICEBREAKER GAME FOR IN-PERSON, INFORMAL NETWORKING SESSIONS

2 players are required to play :P


How it works?

10 questions where you choose either A or B.

To start, Player 1 chooses their favorite option.

Then, Player 2 tries to guess Player 1's choice.

As you go, you both take turns.


How to use it?

  1. Connect your Nintendo Switch controllers to your computer (Or use the Keyboard)
  2. Set the computer in a table and place the controllers in front
  3. Play the prototype, allow fullscreen, and let the people read their minds :)


There's more instructions to change the questions, change the game logic and even change the language.


The Story

For the first in-person event of Friends of Figma Barcelona I wanted the members have a good time and interact with each other, but sometimes we need a little help to do so. I recreated an experience I had years ago in a design agency party, where there was a game-alike experiential installation to foster communication and networking (because we didn‚Äôt know each other). This is my adaptation of that delightful experience: a port using only Figma Interactive Components and my personal add-ons.

And It worked pretty good!
